Message.Title: YHOO's remaining holdings in Alibaba is worth over $34 billion
Message.Msg: "Alibaba is a verified Internet colossus; it’s set to see in higher sales volume than Amazon and eBay combined this year and is aiming to hit 3 trillion RMB ($474 billion) in sales within five to seven years. " The combined market value of Amazon and eBay is around $170 billion. Alibaba has more sales, and apparently has more growth potential, so it's value should be at least equal to $170 billion. YHOO still holds 20% of Alibaba, which is worth at least $34 billion.

Topic.Title: YHOO's remaining holdings in Alibaba is worth over $34 billion

Message.Msg: The tiny fact that Alibaba is offering its services free where eBay and Amazon are importing billions in commissions seems relevant to me. So much that today Yahoos share of Alibaba is at most just worth the $5 billion after tax they can possibly get today.

Message.Title: yahoos hackers and booters
Message.Msg: will the booters and hackers that are now shutting down yahoos games rooms be able to spread to other areas of yahoo and effect advertisers revenue

Topic.Title: YHOO's remaining holdings in Alibaba is worth over $34 billion

Message.Msg: I bet you know little about Alibaba. Offering services free?? LOL. Alibaba owns Taobao, the largest online shopping in the world. NO free service there. They charge high fees from all sellers, and commissions from all sales, and the make loans and charges interests, and they even issue their online currency, and they also provide insurance, mapping, etc., of course, they charge fees.
